N85nHmwMrBLr5wz88tmMag.text: Absolutely Amazing!!! The atmosphere is energizing with upbeat island hits and decor to match. The wait staff are well educated on the menu and choices and offer great suggestions. The bar staff are fabulous and victuals are to die for and food delicious! One of our wings fell during playing and they let us know and brought it out shortly after. We tried a little bit of everything and it exceeded our expectations! Seating has options as well with a more bar atmosphere in front and an option for quieter restaurant feel in the back. Perfect for date night, happy hour, big groups, and everything between. We will be back very soon.

8tAiyKiUs8ntuEcvydYJQA.text: I used to walk by on my way to market square and watch the construction progress. I've been wanting to go to this restaurant before I even knew its name. I am so happy that this place exceeded my expectations. Now there are a lot of restaurants in Pittsburgh and a good portion of them are gimmicky and trendy and lacking in the quality food. Pirata is not one of them! I ordered the Jamaican Beef Patty empanada and the Mahi Mahi tacos. My friend ordered Arrachada tacos (Skirt steak). Everything was outstanding, fresh and flavorful. My fish was cooked and seasoned perfectly and the steak was surprisingly tender and juicy. Their house made hot sauce is spicy and sweet but a perfect addition. I'm typically not a fan of hot sauces but I drizzled that mix on everything. The restaurant itself is beautiful. The bar is large and we watched as the bartender squeezed all fresh juices for the mixed drinks. The art is breathtaking and just fun look at. They have massive murals of sea creatures and ships. I'm already planning my return trip for both cocktails and a visit with my family. This is a must try new restaurant in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mahi Mahi tacos

jBu1-eF15EKkp6YhGmrqdQ.text: We tried Pirata this past Friday and we will definitely be back.  Our server and the manager were both very attentive and we both enjoyed our meals.  The guacamole was great and a picture of our cocktail pitcher generated a bunch of questions from our friends.

jWJ7CZy4TMB2lsx8_hLUrw.text: Went there with 3 coworkers and were seated immediately without a reservation (6:30 wens night). Food was delicious. I had beef empanada, Cajun mac and cheese and the croquettes. All were fantastic. I was too full for dessert but the de leche sounded awesome. Service was fantastic and was served quickly, but not too quick. Owner/ mgr stopped by several times to see how we liked our food. Would definitely go back whenever I'm in Pittsburgh.

OH_R48vnpJPJpwA_hd3Xrw.text: Pirata greets you with blaring music, which is perfect if you have no intention of hearing those with you but less than stellar if you're interested in engaging in meaningful conversation. The food is acceptable, but nothing to write home about. And, the service, while friendly, is not the most adept, The bus boy tried to clear one of our plates AFTER we mentioned that we were not yet done and then offered no apologies. If your fingers have gone into my to-be-finished plate, at least have the courtesy to acknowledge that you've ruined the end of my meal.

JPtIstMxTux84c69CK8kcA.text: Oh mama, the empanadas ! DARN YOU PIRATA!!!  Very good food. EXCELLENT service. We had a server name Matt. He was so attentive and very detail about what the dishes and the meals look like. I love this place. My husband and I will be celebrating our anniversary here, as often as possible. We hope you stay open for many more years to come.  I did take photos of the food. Some dishes do not look in photos, especially with the lighting. Over all, very good food. Prices were right. We will be returning !!!  I had the jerk chicken dish and my husband had the steak. Perfectly seasoned and cooked. try the dessert the Tres Leches! OH YUM!

fO737PuPpv59EnNkWrDalQ.text: Friendly staff and clean/unique environment. Went here for my birthday and left unimpressed with the food. The Ropa Vieja lacked flavor and the Jamaican beef patty was not authentic. Portions were great for the price. But I would not suggest this place if you are looking for authentic Caribbean food.

QF4I7KT7OTN1gPCNkXutrw.text: 3 pm meal on a weekday; pretty slow time of day. Service was friendly but slow. Wife had jerk goat and it was fantastic. I had chicken and rice, filling but unremarkable. Also had delicious fried plantains.

II1Uw0qTC7nKhqmRn4z_9w.text: Sensational food, huge portions. The Cuban sandwich was gigantic and mostly meat. The ripe plantains were creamy and delicious. The empenada was small but mighty and the red salsa with it was delicious. I nearly ate it by itself. Had a white sangria that was disturbingly strong but really delicious and refreshing. Loved the drunk pineapple on a stick that came in it. Could have eaten about 20 of those then passed out in the street on my way back to work.  Think I found a new lunchtime favorite.

iW2J-QO19BIOyuV-uJq2kQ.text: Frita sliders were dry and actually made husband sick. Crab cakes were too peppery. Drinks very expensive!!!! Hoped to hear more reggae. Probably OK for millennials.

HOceuq-bkf-WCjnKpYq76w.text: Good atmosphere, good snacks, great drinks!   Bartender was on point, and made some really tasty cocktails and had great wine recommendations.   Charcuterie was good. Ordered empenadas, but were out of them; we replaced with the croquettes, and manager came over to apologize for the confusion and comped the replacement croquettes.   Relaxed atmosphere, good music, unique food selection - would go back!

nmwU4sP8OTvlSb792hYmUQ.text: J and I came here for a late lunch/early dinner today after seeing a play. I am always skeptical about Caribbean food, as my family is Caribbean and I have high expectations. I'll start with the Pros: the decor was very pretty. Nice murals, bar top, and stools. We sat at the bar to watch the Steeler's game while we ate our food and spoke to the bartender who was very friendly. The prices for the food were fairly decent. I got the Caribbean crab cakes to start and the sea bassa sandwich with tomatoes, spicy mayo, arugula, and spicy ketchup. J ordered the jerk chicken and subbed the rice and beans for fries. Everything was around $40. Now the cons: despite the food sounding tasty, it actually wasn't. There was a major emphasis on spicy that it masked the flavor of everything we ate. I couldn't tell you what my fish tasted like, and J described his jerk chicken as "spicy sawdust". Plus, my fish sandwich was way too messy, which made the experience poor overall. Another con was the smell. There was the smell of fried fish wafting around the bar/dining area, which was very unpleasant and difficult to ignore. We figured dessert couldn't be that bad, so we ordered two orders of the rum bread pudding. Unfortunately they were all out...at 4pm? When we walked in, another couple was leaving. We were the only people in there for the duration of our meal, which lasted about an hour. Needless to say, we do not plan on returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Third half of the mural. J makes a cameo
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Second half of the mural by the bar
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty mural by our seats

PnofXVMqimKH1ScGsTUNjA.text: We haven't dined here but the bar is great and so is the service. Nice addition to that part of market square and not another Italian place!! Always good place to grab a drink etc. will have to get back about the food

QPgGaID9SDLUbI-w5wzT-A.text: I was really looking forward to trying his restaurant. I was not disappointed! Delicious, great location, great service-it has it all.

DJJZFUY-eqyXv0bkK9Zt_Q.text: This was a great restaurant and I received excellent customer service from the owner and the waitress. I ordered the Jerk Chicken dinner and they allowed me to preview their newest mango hot sauce. It was amazingly hot and delicious. Jason and Jac were good to me, if I ever find myself in Pittsburgh I'll be sure to go there for my Caribbean food!

CXRNZjnw9CH6704zIl1lMA.text: Lively atmosphere with good energy, decided to sit at the bar to avoid wait for a table. Took around five to ten min to get service. The bar tender was very helpful and friendly, suggested the Cuban sandwich. I should have taken his suggestion and kept it simple. I went with the Arroz con Pollo which was disappointing. Visually the dish looked great but the rice was overcooked and sticky. It had an overpowering taste of olives which should be an accent to the dish. The  chicken was a mix or dark and light meat which wasn't very flavorful. At one point I bit into the meat only to find it was a piece of fat, needless to say I was a bit disappointed that I spend $20 on a dish that lacked an authentic flavors. I would still go back but I would limit my visits to tropical drinks.

dlJmosH_9YbDY3dyj5qWgw.text: A must-try in Pittsburgh! Outstanding (food, service, atmosphere etc.) all around. Will definitely be back soon!

vI11WqWKxUlT5B51LvsZ1Q.text: Great concept. Food (Chicken dish) was super salty and overpriced for the portion amounts...

FK-zt16UORxBv4wIO6kiLQ.text: One of the best tacos I've had in pittsburgh. It's a great atmosphere, great Caribbean theme and the mural is gorgeous. Would highly recommend for foodies looking for a lot of flavor in each bite.

Ko0SGMpwUvA4OJG_s9x1Bw.text: Cool atmosphere. A lot of unique rum drinks. Only had one thing on the menu but it was tasty.

dzShND2VB3MLm2MFnIO_Tw.text: I am absolutely in LOVE with Pirata.  Everything is amazing. I really wish they carried more crab and shrimp plates, since it is caribbean and all.  However, it makes up in atmosphere and deliciousness.  The Arroz con Pollo is magnificent with a smokey flavor that's just bold enough to stick with you, but not enough to be over powering.   Just one piece of advice: At Pirata, the rum is NEVER gone.  :)

KsjbBiiqYdY0Ci9Q0RyCJw.text: Went at lunch and got there a bit before noon and it was dead. Expected it to be more crowded but when I left at 1 there wasn't more than 5 guests. Food was good, but seemed a bit pricey for lunch. We sat in the bar area so the bartender was also our waiter. Interested to see how the crowd is at happy hour. Bar looked great

dxyxgyreiZ6vECrXSWn9GA.text: we went for dinner Friday night - were seated right away in a booth in the back of the restaurant. Service was very friendly and fast almost too fast - because he was almost every 2 minutes asking if we were ready to order. Nice thing - you have the choice between sparkling and still water and you get a bottle (for free) on the table. We have started with some drinks from the bar - a Stoned Manhattan and a Strawberry Daquiri  with some Papas Bravas - potatoes with a spicy sauce. We shared the Pescado Tacos and two salads (Pirata and the Baby Kale). The food was really great. We finished with Tres Leches - a cake with marshmallows and some milk / cream, nothing special but ok. Overall a good place with reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres Levhes
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pescado Tacos
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Papas Bravas

Usn0bIRXugFFpMhHcghcJQ.text: My husband and I stopped here for lunch during the Rum, Rock and Reggae Festival a couple weeks ago.  I had the SMOKED JACKFRUIT taco. Loved the idea, but the tortilla was a bit crumbly and unmanageable. My husband had the JAMAICAN CURRIED GOAT taco, which he found kind of watery and small.   I'd say this place has potential and I'd like to try more menu items - it just didn't knock our socks off the first time around.

eKC6bIYrBZ4-ynG7Hqd_jA.text: This place is not an authentic Caribbean restaurant. But their beef patties are really good. I wish there were more people that looks like me who works there.

WbmQ2NmPs3SKEUpVogr8ww.text: Not impressed.  Lone highlight was our server who was excellent.  Ordered a mojito and I don't think it had any rum in it.  My wife order two different fruity drinks that tasted like they came directly out of a can.  Dinners were over spiced when they didn't need to be and tasted quite bland.  Wings were good but that's about it.  I wouldn't waste time or money going back.

fZmgnGN9JNEjC4_u5eCpRw.text: Delicious, fresh food. Large cocktails. No wait and great service. I am also impartial to getting tasty cocktails, and large portions. There are also boozy drinks and a daiquiri flight which I will do next time. I'm not from the Caribbean so I cannot genuinely say it is authentic because I did not grow up on this cuisine, but I will say I will be back and bring friends. Tres leches is on it's way so I'll keep you posted.  * the tres leches came and it melted in your mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Cubano was enormous. Literally enough for 2 meals. I had a Mojito Royale and another is on its way!

CMqAsjPw5JcVugRIPPu6Hg.text: This is my second time at this restaurant; I was eager to come back after the first visit. I generally like the atmosphere and the location. The food is very good, tho wish there was better selection. For example, they have the mango guacamole on the menu; but wish there was just plain guac (which I supposed I could try asking for; I didn't..). I wasn't a big fan of the skirt steak dish because it came out more like a stew, with a TON of onions. I expected a sliced piece of skirt steak.. But other dishes I tried were delicious! The drinks menu is great too.

t3coy4t4VXkqW99m0JWldg.text: Meh. Sat at the bar w hubby. Food wasn't that great in my opinion. Bartenders have mastered the art of avoiding eye contact so we didn't get to order a second drink after waiting 10 minutes to order our first. I'll probably not go back.

Qal9DowA6dqdQU0J8-BYmg.text: I expected excellent food based on other reviews but was unfortunately not impressed. A lot of our food lacked flavor or was dry. The sangria was spicy which was unexpected. The guacamole, however, was excellent. What really bothered me about this restaurant was the extremely lacking service. Our server questioned one of our orders by saying "that's all for you?" Not the best way to suggest this may be a lot of food. The guacamole came with about ten plantain chips, not enough for the quantity of guacamole. We asked for more, were given about ten, and were charged THREE dollars in addition to the base charge for the guacamole.

2uXREBQQx3TK6XNupvuuBg.text: I loved this place until I went back a second time. The first time I had the jerk chicken sandwich and the chicken was so crunchy, juicy and flavorful. I also tried an empanada which was great. Drinks were also good, and exotic.   The second time I had tacos. The flavors were good but the taco was extremely soggy. I could barely pick up the tortilla because it was soaked in juices of whatever was in it/salsa. The people I was with felt their food was average, but loved the coconut collard greens.   Overall: pretty good food, attentive service, and cool decorations/vibe.

ZVF0lqF99djFFBjuJA2UMQ.text: Wow! What a find... If you're in Pittsburgh and want some amazing food, head to Pirata!  Can't say enough about the flavors, presentation and staff.  Our server Mirta and the GM Greta were wonderful! They made us feel right at home!  Highly recommend the Oxtail, and the Bread Pudding, too!  If you're in Pittsburgh, don't miss this place. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0IC34V0YK-G70FV7Fh_i8Q.text: Yes, please! Give me more Pirata!  The food is perfect and different!  This is my favorite place for a date with my husband.  The salt cod fritters are amazing, the cocktails are outstanding, the food is wonderful and comforting. I love this place and I love the atmosphere.  The service is always great.

2G-ro-BM2V1qrhbH4A2LRg.text: Excellent service and awesome cocktails! Not having much experience with rum, we got the rum flight and were pleasantly surprised at how distinct each selection was. The tacos we ordered were delicious. The empanadas tasted as close to legit on this side of town.

1mopNOxE6IKsUVJyRkUR3A.text: am so proud of how far this place has come. The manager, Greta is wonderful. The French fries are divine. They're running smoothly now and it's one of my favorites

RW7ez-EXkjoTE4YSpnVmjw.text: How refreshing! Finally a diverse restaurant with a wonderful variety of foods that challenges my palate with familiar, cultural flavors and new flavors that are enticing!!! So tired of the bland palate of the usual pittsburgh restaurants and so nice to not have the usual fried 'everything' & being offered fries on everything. We had the wings with a yummy Guava barbecue sauce, tostones with a garlic sauce, sliders, and Trinidad cod saltfish fritters. The wings were perfect! Tender, juicy and the Guava subtly came through the barbecue to really enhance the flavor. The sliders were good. The tostones took me back home!!! They were DELICIOUS! The garlic sauce was a nice addition, but I would have preferred a cream garlic sauce ( just a personal choice). The selfish cod fritters were good. A little salty, but so tender and so fried perfectly. Both the wings and the fritters were accompanied by a dip, that wasn't explained in the menu. A sort of cucumber/avocado dip with a little kick to it. That was ok, but not really good. The service was beautiful from the moment we walked through the door to the moment we left. The waitress knew the menu, and was able to guide our choices and I appreciated that. We will definitely return to try more menu choices...they're so many!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guava wings and Tostones!!!! The pic says it all!!!
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sliders for my girl!!!!

bRTqM-FbwAKxHVpYvVEwuw.text: If you stick to tacos, French fries, and straight rum, you'll be in good shape. The rest of the menu is iffy.

kv7432uOmMnf85fDAgArOA.text: My wife and I met in Market Square to grab some lunch.  We decided to go to one of the burrito places and as we were walking to it, we ran into one of her friends.  He had just come from Pirata and suggested we go there.  What the heck, why not try something new?  So we headed off to Pirata.  The first thing I'll say is that our bill was $38.  For 2 people.  For 3 menu items.  That's expensive for lunch.  The second thing I'll say is that it was worth every penny.  It was probably the best meal I've had in a while.  We only got three things but each one was delicious, perfectly plated and in just the right portions.  One big plus is that they bring you a bottle of COLD water and leave it at the table.  I drink a lot of water so I was especially thankful for this.   We started off with the smoked pineapple guacamole.  Quite possibly the best guac I've ever had.  The smoked pineapple is a great addition to the guac, giving it the perfect hint of sweetness.  It was plated with some large leaves in the guac (maybe from a pineapple?) and more than enough fried plantain and malanga chips that were presented wrapped up with a bow.    For our meals we got the tacos which included 2 tacos each that were delivered on a cutting board or random piece of wood.  I got the jerk chicken and she got the mahi mahi.  The jerk sauce was super spicy but not overly spicy and also super delicious.  It was complemented well with a sweet mango chutney and a refreshing cucumber raiata.  Her mahi was breaded and cooked to perfection and topped with pickled red cabbage and jalapenos.  We didn't say a word for about 3 minutes and then our tacos were gone.  It all happened so fast.     The other great thing about the place was the music which, when we were there, was a remix of 80s tunes (mostly Michael Jackson) into reggae.  I liked it.

6aqIGVP4zifZ7zc6XG2eqg.text: Love the food & decor. Wish the happy hour wasn't just at the bar because it gets crowded.

msz7xOcRHM4XVSsfdUUCdw.text: First, I must say that I really wanted to enjoy this place. The ambiance is great and it's pretty (except for the large mural on the wall... seems a bit kiddy).  The bar is beautiful, seating is comfortable, and they have many drink options... One of the guys working there even helped me to my seat (chivarly isn't dead!). We sat at a table near the bar.   My friends and I came here since we had a reservation at another nearby restaurant.  We were here specifically for drinks, and we had 30 minutes for a drink and walk to the other restaurant. Our server was SUPER nice and friendly and walked us through their drink menu... I asked if there was a typo on the drink menu because of a $400 rum/cocktail flight called "Millionaire".  Who gets this flight??? Anyways, I digress....  Since we only had 30 minutes we told our server of our reservations we had, and ordered our drinks immediately - we were 2 couples, a group of 4.  My girlfriend and I had two rum flights because we figured it has to be one of the easiest drinks to prepare - pour 3 "shots" in a nice glass and keep it moving.  Next, the husbands order some sort of dark liquor cocktails. I know my husband ordered a manhattan because he's as predictable as they come.  I can't remember what my friend's husband ordered, but it was some cocktail.   10 minutes later we wave down our server like "Hey, did you put in our drink order?" She's like "Yeah let me see what's up." She never returned to give us an update.  10 minutes later we wave down our server like "Hey, Ummmmmmm..... Drinks?" She didn't return to give us an update.  5 minutes later... 25 minutes since we placed the order... The guys get their cocktails, and I inquired about the rum flights that weren't in hand.  She had no response, and instead we reminded her of our reservation. So to run things along we also had to ask for the check before we even got our rum flights... So we got our check, paid for our drinks before we even received our rum flights... Did they forget about us? Was the bar busy? We were watching the bar since we had 30 minutes of time to waste and they just seemed to be in "chill mode" as if they were actually on a Caribbean island. If we would've known it would have taken over 30 minutes to get 4 drinks I would've never come.  So, we were late to our other reservations.... I was extremely sad. I cannot speak to the food, but the drinks took entirely too long to get to us.  It will likely be a while until I come back to try any of the food.

RHc6Y0pRCMUJ-4m9O66_YQ.text: Delicious. Smoked pineapple guacamole was the perfect amount and came with long plantain chips. They have two house hot sauces that were both fire-y and excellent in their own ways. C loved the jerk chicken tacos. I got a chopped salad with jerk chicken and found it to be a little bland compared to everything else we'd tasted. The cocktails were rum takes on old standards and were perfect.

Sph5IcUVFlRA-XuFM7yfkQ.text: Kind of stumbled upon Pirata's while searching for a place to eat after watching a Saturday matinee at the Benedum.  I noticed a Yelp friend was checked in here and saw that it is a Caribbean restaurant which piqued my interest.  I quickly glanced over a picture of the menu someone had posted on Yelp and decided to give it a go.    I found the restaurant aesthetically pleasing with cool Caribbean colors and decor.  We decided to sit at the bar.  It was early about 4 PM so the place was a little empty being there between lunch and dinner.  Our bartender/waitress was warm and welcoming.  She got us started with a couple of drinks and I inquired about their fish tacos or Pescado and how they were cooked as I don't like fried food.  She confirmed they were deep fried.  I asked if they could be grilled or broiled instead.  She mentions she can ask the kitchen.  When she makes it back to us she announced that they can grill them instead.  Great!  Ordered two grilled Pescado taco plates, and two empanadas one Jamaican Beef Patty and one Pollo Fricassee.  While we waited I checked out the rest of their menu and there was some interesting sounding dishes that I would definitely want to come back and try.  Some time goes by and our food comes out.  All of it at the same time.  This isn't a huge deal but it would have been nice to have the empanadas first as an appetizer but we didn't clarify that we wanted it that way so no biggie.  I looked down at my taco's and thought these look fried, a very light fry but fried.  I poked them with my finger to see how they felt when the manager (assuming he was) came up behind us and asked if we ordered the grilled fish tacos.  We said yes and he grabbed both plates and apologized saying they were fried and he would have a fresh set up briefly.  I was happy he jumped right in and made the situation right without me having to flag anyone down.  Also gave us time to enjoy our empanadas.  They came with a red relish, but it was lacking some flavor.  I think a little heat, fresh cilantro and some citrus would have helped that relish a lot.  The empanadas were good but not sure I would order them again.  The dough to meat ratio seemed off, but nevertheless enjoyable.    After some time the manager approaches us and apologized saying the kitchen made our tacos again but not to his liking so he had them redo the redo.  He said we will take care of the tacos and again was very apologetic.  I was completely fine, especially since he was really being a customer service rock star.  He went on to tell us that they have only been open for two weekends and have some kinks to work out.  A little time later our tacos make another appearance in front of us.  The taco's looked great and came with a nice vinegar Caribbean slaw, a corn salsa, and a slice of lime.  I was preparing my tacos for lift off to my mouth and on first bite I noticed they were still raw and cold in the center.  I mention it to my husband who seems to think I should just eat them the way they are when I say they aren't just undercooked they are cold.  I bring it to the bartender's attention and she apologized and asked if there was anything else on the menu they could bring me.  I told her I really want the tacos and am fine waiting on a re-fire.  In the interim, Matt shared his plate with me so we could both eat.  His were cooked right and tasted great.  The fourth and last plate of tacos came out a short while later and I am happy to report that they were cooked wonderfully and I was a happy customer.  They did forget to bring the salsa with this plate but I quickly asked and was taken care of.    On our way to leave the bartender was pretty down on the establishment and made a comment to the tune of I hope we did something right tonight.  I told her we'd definitely be back.  Even though there were some hiccups the manager and server/bartender took care of them right away and in the end it was a lovely meal in an appealing atmosphere.  I hope they iron out their kinks soon and are a huge success.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ask for the grilled option
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pescado tacos
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish taco

uFsy9Z-l3oGdcy2O1j4LjQ.text: Andy the bartender could not take some constructive criticism about his pina colada and would not serve us another round of drinks. A good bar but Andy (the guy with glasses) is the racist or insecure about the drinks he makes.

4wqOzwH3oKZHHvTzdJiz8g.text: This place rocks! My wonderful husband took me here for my birthday and it was a fantastic experience from beginning to end. The restaurant is located just off Market Square in downtown Pittsburgh. The atmosphere is lovely and well-lit with a big bar in the middle and plenty of space for both hanging out with a drink and sitdown dining. It was pretty crowded when we were there and the space and music really created a fun vibe.   Our server appeared promptly and was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. They have a big drink list with many, many different kinds of rum, rum flights (!), cocktails and wine. My husband ordered a rum flight. Tip: apparently the 1 oz and 2 oz flights cost the same. The flight was 3 two-ounce tumblers of rum and according to my husband all were excellent. My pregnant self really wanted a "cocktail" and they were kind enough to make me a virgin pina colada which was delicious.   We started with appetizers and ordered the Jamaican mac and cheese pie, the pollo fricasee empanada and the pineapple guacamole. The mac and cheese pie was stellar. Please order it. I also really enjoyed the empanada - I was expecting the shell to be crispier, but it was still good. The guacamole came with fried plantain and yucca chips which I loved. The guacamole itself was freshly made (it comes with sprouts on top, btw) but there was an overpowering smoky flavor that I wasn't a huge fan of. Not sure if it had bacon or something. The appetizer plates are pretty small for the price.   Next we ordered entrees. I had the black bean soup with a side of tostones and my husband had the jerk chicken. The soup had a good flavor, but it was just too salty for me. However, the tostones were DELICIOUS. Tostones are double-fried plantains that are usually eaten like French fries. These were much bigger than the ones I'm used to and came with a garlic topping. They were served with a spicy, creamy aji pepper dipping sauce. Different than I've usually seen them served, but they were perfectly crunchy and well seasoned and the sauce was a great complement. I do wish they'd come with some ketchup too, though. My husband loved the jerk chicken - it comes over rice and greens.   Finally, we ordered tres leches cake for dessert. I absolutely love tres leches and this one was outstanding. It came topped with a meringue cream and cherries which I personally could've done without because the cake itself was so delicious. It was light and airy and moist and sweet and amazing as tres leches should be. The piece was HUGE so definitely recommend sharing.   Overall - this place was great! As others have said, it is a little pricey but great for a special occasion. Highly recommend checking it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres leches cake!
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese pie, pineapple guacamole, and empanada (and rum flight and piña colada)

Ux04e-g7K_bUQK-uWvbJIQ.text: Came here for lunch and at 11:30, it wasn't quite that busy yet, but it quickly became a full house by noon. I was really curious about this place and our waitress introduced the place as "Pittsburgh's first Caribbean restaurant." I don't believe this statement is entirely accurate, but maybe she meant downtown Pittsburgh?  The rum menu was very extensive while the food menu seemed limited in comparison. But wow, the food was so flavorful and everything was prepared really well! My favorite? The empanadas, which were buttery, filling was not at all dry, and loaded with great flavor. They were served with sauces (appeared to be a type of red salsa for one and a spicy mayonnaise for another), which I didn't even think was necessary.   As with many new restaurants, Pirata could benefit from a little more time to work out all the kinks. The speed of the service during this visit was extremely slow. We were there for an hour and still did not receive our food; we had to, unfortunately, ask them to box up our food to go. However, since we waited so long, the manager made it up to us by offering a gift card to give them a second chance. How nice was that??  Trust me, we did not complain as we understood the learning curve new restaurants must go through so this offer was too generous.   Despite having a long wait, the delicious food will blow you away and help you forget that you waited so long for it.

Q4Zit-YE-QBx1C1EnfaAxQ.text: Had the joy of trying this new restaurant today. Their rum menu is huge, and they have cocktail flights and fruity tropical drinks. I tried the Zombie flight and each one was delicious, and deceptively strong. It was $18, but considering each drink of was a solid 1-2 shots and were a perfect blend of subtle fruitiness, I think overall it's a good deal, especially to share. I wasn't a fan of the strawberry daiquiri personally, but they are usually too sweet for me. The food was good, an mix of Cuban, Puerto Rican, Peruvian, Jamaican, etc. I recommend the empanadas ($2 each), especially the chicken and the Jamaican patty. For the entrees, I tried the Ropa Vieja and the fish tacos (2 tacos). Both were solid dishes with fresh ingredients, but semi-pricey as is expected with the area ($23, $15 respectively).   The staff was very attentive and did a great job for being such a new restaurant. Atmosphere was great, liked the reggae music. Also had TVs to watch the pens game. I will definitely return to try more appetizers and cocktails, and the desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak

7N_51rNGLIuPLWaX9dgEWg.text: This place is cool, no doubt.   I am a rum connoisseur and any place that has the name Pirat in it is a must see for me. I went here to have drinks with a friend and I won't lie, the vibe and atmosphere are great.  I pulled my signature, "Would you be able to make me a caiparinha" trick and...to be honest, not bad. Could've held off on the soda water but hey it's all good.   I didn't eat the food because to me this place is reflected better by its cocktails. Very good selection of drinks.  Didn't really get a Caribbean vibe. It looks more like a fancy restaurant you would find at  a Bahamas resort. But that's okay, it keeps in tune with the other establishments in the area. When I think tropical vibe I think Hidden Harborn in Squirrel Hill..now that place looks tropical as all hell.   AWESOME rum selection. When my buddy from Trinidad is in town we will come back for sure.   Overall, not a bad addition to Market Square. A good place to just meet up with friends, have some decent cocktails before going downtown or off to Perle to mingle with the cast of Desperate Housewives.

o4HdlS0vLzPHLHYYG2mfXw.text: Exciting find downtown Pittsburgh! Cool Rum bar restaurant, nice island feel, but not cheesy. We tried tacos (jerk shrimp, chicken, pork) all Of which were pretty good. The bacon guacamole was ok, but excited to try the rum and go back to get introduced to a few at a time. Great date night, or ladies out spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DkKokU5i1TwTWe2ooP6GyQ.text: The food was unusual in a great way!!  I had the Jerk Chicken which was seasoned deliciously and very tender!  The Salmon was cooked well with Caribbean flavors. The pineapple ceviche sauce had just the right amount of heat!  Our server Jaylee was very personable, helpful, and attentive!!  What a hidden gem!!!

0z7E_BK1adAOe5WKZXZbaQ.text: I wanted to try carribean cuisine for a long time now. So I was looking forward to eating at Pirata. The place has an excellent ambience and an overwhelming choice of rums. All the rum lovers must check this place. The appetizers were really good, especially the empanadas. The entree tacos were a hit and miss. My husband ordered jerk chicken and i ordered the jerk shrimp. Both of us loved the jerk shrimp. Its something coming from my husband who is not too fond of shrimp. But the jerk chicken eas disappointing. It did not go well with the raita dip it was served with. I wish it had a little more kick. The portion sizes was enough for me but my husband was still hungry when we left the place.

8PwT6s9grHhv6EDFt40jsA.text: It was a dark and stormy night . . . Really, it was. We decided to get a little dinner and thought we would try Pirata. I had heard good things about it. The decor is fun and then cozy once they turned the lights low. The bar was hopping and the restaurant was over half full. People were really enjoying their drinks and there dining experience.  I was tempted by the empanadas but ordered the Cuban Steak.  It was one of the priciest items on the menu. It had beans and rice as a side. My hubby ordered a chicken and rice meal. I kept checking out everyone's Caribbean cocktails. I also kept looking at the decor. My youngest son is fascinated with Pirates and it made me think of him. When my Steak came it looked great. It had a lot of onions on top. I'm not a huge fan of onions but my husband loves them so he ate most of them. The flavor of the steak was very bright. They had marinated it with lime and spices. Lime or any citrus usually breaks down the toughness of meat. The Steak was big but very thin. It was too chewy. . . almost tough. It also had some spots that seemed like gristle that I couldn't eat. The citrus had not broken down the fibers of the Steak. The Steak was delicious but I could only eat about half. The beans were good but could have used some seasoning. I liked my meal but didnt love it. What I loved was my hubby's chicken and rice dish. In fact we both loved it.  Needless to say that our meal had highs and lows. So we're going back for a second try. This time I'm ordering the empanadas and a fun Caribbean drink to start and go from there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic &amp; Lime Cuban Steak
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and Rice
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zcLx5CuiDPS8q3kf59MviQ.text: I sat at the bar so I don't know if that's why I got such good service but even so, the food speaks for itself!   We got the cheese empanadas and the chicken ones and for the price ($4) they are outstanding. I crave them on random days because they're so delicious. My friend had the Cuban sandwich and it came with fries and some delicious Jamaican ? ketchup - the manager saw I loved it and brought me some to take home! It is honestly so delicious!!   The drinks were pretty expensive - $13 for a Moscow mule that didn't match the price. However, expensive drinks aren't really a reason to not go because the food is phenomenal!

pZ_gE2Ct8B2ANSK2hkc3Dg.text: Place was really fun! I had passed by a couple of times, and am glad I finally went in. The cocktails were refreshing, perfectly in theme, and delicious. Wait was a little long for the cocktails- which is to be expected, since it takes a while to make, but they were well worth it! We had a Mai Tai and a Bruja - both were delicious. The Mai Tai was easily the best I've ever had. Didn't try the food, but will definitely be back for it in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty great cocktails! Service is a little slow because the drinks take a while to make, but it&#39;s worth the wait!

9nzBGLyY-_8_TPX5dVpmfw.text: Unfortunately, I was disappointed. Maybe this is considered good Latin food by the locals but I must say the food here fails in comparison to any authentic Latino food. Come for a drink or a Spanish beer but save your appetite for some other place.

NcJl6BR1MMHX0zd_oupCRg.text: First time for us at Pirata.  We ordered first from the absolutely large variety of rums/beers etc and were not disappointed. The cafe con leche cuban style was delicious , the appetizer chose was crab cakes and we have never had such tasty, flavorful crab cakes in the burgh. Empanas were delicious, arroz con pollo authentic and full of flavor, the tacos de pescado were un believable.  All in all, we will be coming to try more different Caribbean options off the menu for future tastings. The atmosphere definitely takes you away from the feeling like you are in Pennsylvania and you feel like you are in the Caribbean. 5 stars, 2 thumbs up and superb wait staff.

SyCCryy_XiukG6j2wj19EA.text: We went there after dinner at Poros based on the recommendation from our server.  We needed a place in close proximity to there bc I was in heels.  We were greeted by the friendly hostess as soon as we walked in the door.  We sat at the bar bc we had already had dinner and just wanted to get a drink.  The atmosphere was cool.  It is an upscale pirate theme.  The bartenders were very nice and checked in on us.  The drinks were good and generous.  We will be back when we have more time.

jxy3iLYY7K8eB1eqt7Zc9g.text: Very delicious food! I was suffering from a brutal hangover and some of the flavors were a little too spicy for me. They bring out two sauces with all the food they were good but super hot! Wish they offered more mild options. Anyways we had shared the jerk chicken 24$ the sandia y honey 12$ and the beef empanadas 4$ everything was delicious! The greens were really good and rice and beans were average but were meant to be mixed with the jerk chicken! We shared the jerk chicken plate and it was plenty of food! The empanadas were awesome and I wanted to order like 20 more lol! The sandia y honey had a lot of flavors was fresh and sweet, the one thing I didn't like was the pickled watermelon rine was too tart for me! Overall it was good but was pretty expensive :( I would eat here more if it was more affordable for a 60$ check with a shared plate of food was crazy and the one ginger ale I had was 3.00.....over all a lot of my rating is due to ambiance and great flavors.....but it comes at a cost!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9ox60Al2P0MI3rGCpaMsmA.text: I walked in and thought to myself wow this is posh. There wish great original artwork on the walls and super comfortable chairs. It has a larger dining room and an available private room. I got there at 6:30pm on a Monday and there were a few tables taken. When we left at 8pm it was perfectly full. Amazingly it never got so loud I had to tell across the table!!!    But enough about the great space. The food is absolutely delicious. I got the pork belly sliders. They are $12 for 2 so a little pricey but certainly not your basic street food. They were exceptional and on home made tortilla! The yucca fries are battered so this was unusual but not at all unwelcome! My dining companion got the Cuban  She finished it without chance of offering. It come with a HUGE mountain of fries and pineapple catchup. A bold move for a Pittsburgh restaurant.   The rum cocktails are both good. The mojito royale is as expected and right. I got the Island Spice and the best way to describe it is "healthy" it's more pickle than cucumber but very good.   Don't forget to try the flan!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork belly tacos! So good!

LnLLolBIXRca_GZ7taaIVw.text: Went here for drinks the other night, so I cannot comment on the food that they have. I really enjoyed the ambiance, decor, and the reggae music that they had playing; it reminding me of a Caribbean vacation! I ordered a Jenny's teacup, which is a rum based drink with a variety of fruit juices that somehow makes it taste a bit like tea! It was delicious, but it was difficult to pay $12 for a single drink. The beer selection was good, and they carried a much more affordable price tag. Overall, we enjoyed our drinks, but I think it was a little overpriced.

MQSfYlYAdc5ysPuxE7E1yg.text: I was really excited to go to Pirata because I adore everything about Caribbean food, especially the fact that it is super vegetarian/pescetarian friendly. When we got there, our waiter asked us if we had any questions about the menu, and I asked for clarification that the "sofrito" part of the Madura Hash and Eggs dish was just a sort of sauce and not a meat component. The waiter then asked if I was vegan or vegetarian, and I said that I was a pescetarian. He then told me he was vegan for 7 years and proceeded to recommend the jackfruit tacos as a good option for me, but I had my eyes between the has and the arepas. He cleared up that the hash DID NOT HAVE MEAT, so I went with the hash because it had everything I loved- plantains, black beans, and sweet potatoes.   So when the hash finally came out, I was in heaven. It looked so good, and it was a very generous portion. When I started to eat it, it definitely tasted a little off. Eventually, I found what appeared to be a piece of pork fat in my dish when I realized- the whole dish tasted a bit like bacon. I then pieced together that the dish must've been cooked in some sort of pork fat or bacon grease or lard. When the waiter came back, I asked him if it was cooked in any of those and he said no. I then showed him the pork fat piece and he asked for it so he could show it to the kitchen. He came back and said that the chef said it was A PLANTAIN. Let me tell you folks, I am very familiar with the texture and appearance of plantains, especially because there were countless plantains in my dish that I could compare it to. This was- and I can say this with almost complete certainty- a piece of pork fat.  I then asked the waiter what the dish was cooked in then. He responded that he didn't know (which, why was this not something he asked the chef when my original question to him was WAS THIS COOKED WITH PORK FAT), so I responded saying, "Well usually dishes like this are cooked in butter or oil" and he goes, as if I had just handed him a "get out of jail free" card, "Oh yes, it's definitely cooked with butter and oils." He then says, "If you come back, I'd really recommend you get the jackfruit tacos, they're the only dish we can really guarantee will be vegan. With everything going on in the kitchen it's hard," as if this was my problem because I didn't order the vegan dish which was the only dish they can guarantee to be meat free. Listen, there's a problem if you can't guarantee that your vegetarian dishes are meat-free, because not all vegetarians want to eat vegan. And even though I love vegan food, I did not want the jackfruit tacos. I wanted to eat the (seemingly) vegetarian dishes, and I should have been able to do that no problem. So in response, I told him that I was in fact vegan for 2 and a half years, and have been pescetarian 2 years after that, and I have eaten out countless of times. I explained that when I go to a restaurant, ESPECIALLY one where the waiter knows I don't eat meat products, they clarify whenever a seemingly vegetarian dish is cooked with a meat component.   My experience at Pirata was really unfortunate because the food was actually good. If you have no problem with your food being cooked in pork lard, then the hash was really delicious. But unfortunately, as my body is very much so not used to eating meat or meat products, I did get a tad sick afterwards. The experience made me really appreciate good restaurants and good waiters where they are attentive to dietary needs, and it would've made a world of difference if the waiter was just honest with me and didn't make it seem like it was my fault for ordering that dish in the first place when I could've gotten the jackfruit tacos and then there would've been no problem at all.

Ljfkn3bYrGXhUV1F_c5JZQ.text: The interior of the restaurant is very cool.  My husband and I had dinner there on Saturday night.  The drinks were ok, and the food was just ok.  We ordered the Mexican street corn and macaroni and cheese as appetizers.  They were the best part of the meal.    For our entrees, we got the jerk grouper (special) and the shrimp with polenta.  The fish was delicious, although the slaw it was served with was average.  Our waiter recommended the shrimp dish, and it was very disappointing.  There were a few shrimp, a large serving of polenta, and it was all covered with a tomato sauce that did not have much flavor.

MU4XpNGJxbJDLcDYIH6ZyA.text: The best rum selection in Pittsburgh. Try a flight of rum so you can taste rums from all over the world. The food is really good with a great blend of Carribean spices and flavors.

yju_bcktYk_CGI_-E0V5Ug.text: This restaurant was really fun.They hace a huge variety of Ron.Great place and good cuban food :)

wdN58Mk5YXiNQSbKI3XPNw.text: Really enjoyed the wings and steak tacos!!! The fries were amazing. The Cuban sandwich was so so. A tad dry. Really really happy this place exists in Pittsburgh! Bring back the churros and chocolate. We miss them!

27kVXMvaHiIVpqXbB-m9jw.text: Wow! Pittsburgh has something special coming over the next few years as pirata continues to develop and introduce new cuisine to the downtown Everyman.  Brand new to the scene, Pirata presents downtown Pittsburgh with an option unlike any other seen before in the area; Beachy cocktails, daiquiris, and mixed drinks made with True Jamaican rums.  I have visited several times - I was here the night they opened and have visited once every week since-  Literally each time there,  I have seen improvements to the already delicious menu. I've had the Ropa vieja twice, every other time I have ordered the steak tacos - the Vieja takes the traditional "spared rags" dish and transforms it into a delicacy. I believe the reason it is so tasty is because the kitchen stays True to the traditional ingredients and recipe which has never been seen before in Pittsburgh; I highly recommend this place for a date, or a night out with the family.

VmL_fu2gxPn3MBX8BK9m8g.text: Best place in Pittsburgh hands down. From the music to the dish! Thank you to the wonderful Bartender/Manager Randolf for making my experience at Pirata a great one! Can't wait to come back and visit!

KktSVms4iSjwQ-gGtlZ4_A.text: Stopped in for drinks today and I asked the bartender if she could make a Capirinha, it turned out absolutely delicious! It's a pretty low-key spot and the decor is fun.

c-Saokj5IYA1iaWJc_ESWQ.text: We really loved the ambiance and the food. The empanadas were great and so were the pork tacos! Save room for dessert!

V30byuv3jx55VD8fTqXggg.text: This was good, not great, but good.  I wasn't blown away by anything I ate, but didn't think anything was bad either.  Would probably not return on food alone, but the atmosphere would be a fun place to go with a group.

sfuip3lLEyAU0D8dgmUi3g.text: I have been to this venue twice and enjoyed both of them. The rum drinks are exceptional. There is also a variety of Caribbean dishes. The only thing I didn't care for was the volume of the DJ music and the lack of Caribbean vibes. A place like this deserves a DJ that plays world music. We all want to be transported to the Caribbean through the music, food, ambiance and drinks.

vZW4jnFyhgm_e7PRErZUtA.text: Drink variety. Quality Service. Bread Pudding! The three reasons I would suggest Pirata. The food is pretty good too, but it won't necessarily blow your mind. The sweet plaintains and beef patty are the two items that lovers of the Jamaican or Cuban variety of food will not be disappointed in. The sweet plaintains are delicious and True to form, the beef patty is softer and less flaky than what you could purchase on the streets of Jamaica. For entrees, the Arroz con Pollo was pretty tasty, and pretty spicy but not great, overall. The croquettes too lack much to be desired. However, if you make it to dessert (or even start with it), the bread pudding with fresh whipped cream is to die for!! You could have it with a glass of any rum known to man and the service you'd receive the entire time would be flawless. Staff is friendly, helpful and genuinely cares about the customer experience. The location is also just far enough away from Market Square to provide good opportunity to actually get parking which is always a huge bonus downtown. Put Pirata on your list.

Hi0eiupl-vChVo38lzmueQ.text: Stopped in for a snack/drink and to watch the Steeler game.  Not real busy but there were a couple of vocal fans having fun.  We started with the Malanga Fritter that had some Jalapeno.  The fritters were good with the jalapeno flavor and disappeared fast.  We then tried some empanadas- I tasted the Jamaican steak and another meat empanada.  Both were very good.  Looking forward to stopping back and trying some of the Caribbean items on the menu.

PdvqnQw6QKwmaql7Ndo9BA.text: Fantastic atmosphere that gives off the feeing of a beach bar with a casual upscale feel that downtown Pittsburgh offers. The spot was great for lunch and assuredly would be a great dinner spot as well. The Cubans is ample and flavorful. The tuna tar tar tacos are light and fresh. Fast and friendly service.

ZG4-0DDPt7ZIZVlBG5sFlA.text: Wings, although a little salty, had great smoke and flavor. I had the Jamaican dry rub and dipped them in the Guava BBQ sauce. The pollo fricassee empanada was by far my favorite with the Jamaican beef a close second.

Dq6-r2LcJ8LRyyM44Wbivw.text: Went here the other day for out Anniversary and it was pretty darn good. Lets start off with the drinks.  Boyfriend got the Peg leg meg and I didn't care for it. Was a little to harsh. I had the Jennys tea cup. It was super sweet but really really good. Refreshing and pretty, Came with an edible flower. For starters we got the adobo wings with their jerk seasoning and a Jamaican beef patty. The wings were stellar! We loved them. They were crispy and i don't know if it was the jerk rub but it has almost a bacony flavor. Wings + bacon flavor = table covered in drool. The Jamaican beef patty was surprisingly pretty amazing but it was so small for the price. For entrees we spilt two dishes. The pork belly tacos and the cubano sandwich. The pork belly tacos were a love hate relationship. The actual pork belly meat was outstanding but they put this sweet potato purree on the tortilla and made it super soggy. We just ate the meat out of it. The cubano was great. Overpriced (considering real Cuban sandwiches go for $5-7 anywhere else) Loved it, Pittsburgh was in need of a good cuban. I subbed French fries for Yuca fries and it was a great choice. All in all I can't really complain. Atmosphere was cool and relaxing and food. I wanna go back and explore the menu some more!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Monstrous but delicious sandwich Cubano

4F6DNqDS0SAch4N8fCOpwA.text: By far, my favorite bar downtown. The ambiance is very chill and cozy and they always have great bartenders. Great selection of rum, my favorite drink is Mutiny on the Bounty...banana and walnut old fashioned, you can't go wrong with it. Their food is incredibly tasty as well. Even just the bar food is delicious, especially the pineapple guac with plantain chips.

PX0yORhwSwoc3j-HXtqMEA.text: This place made me feel as though I was in the caribbean. The food and staff were equally amazing. Best restaurant I have been to in a long time.

VYZonUfogMCQabJgoHUVGA.text: The decorations will take you to the Caribbean in a second. The food is reminiscent of being in the islands. It was put together well. My only complaint was the portions were kind of small for the price. Two tacos for $12 Is a lot.

z5VH96xwLbi327iRTB7qKA.text: The management and staff at Pirata are amazing!  I highly suggest the guacamole as a starter. Since I only eat fish I had the Grouper dinner. It was cooked to perfection. So many restaurants over cook fish. What a treat to find a chief who knows how to cook! The drinks are amazing. Ask your bartender or server for suggestions, they will not steer you wrong. I will be going back and will bring my friends.

gWIsL1_PYQIQTxspJ3xPjA.text: ARGHHH!  I feel like that's the most appropriate way to begin my review of Pirata. I've been wanting to try this place since it opened approximately 6 weeks ago. Unfortunately, after reading some of the prior reviews, I wanted to give the restaurant some time to work out the opening kinks before I went. Since opening, the Executive Chef has already been replaced, which I was told was a good thing, but not a strong start. So Pirata is a new Caribbean-themed Rum-Bar and Restaurant a stone's throw from Market Square on Forbes, and is co-owned and operated by the proprietor of Il Pizziaolo (Mt. Lebo, Warrendale, and Market Square) and Bob Wolfinger (formerly of Bravo! and Latitude 40). I used to work for Bob, and I know that when a man spends over 10K a week on CHEESE for his restaurants, my expectation for Pirata was high. Sadly, I was underwhelmed.   First let me say that if you try to make a reservation online, you will not be able to, because the software they use on their website isn't designated for the Pittsburgh market yet, so you must call in order to do so. I made a reservation for 7 on a Saturday night at 8PM. The fact that I was able to do so somewhat made me nervous, as newer restaurants tend to not have such open availability, but having saw the menu and newer reviews, we kept our reservation.  Our party was seated promptly, but that's perhaps the only thing that went well. I'm willing to forgo bad service for excellent food, but that just wasn't the case. Having worked in the restaurant industry for many years, I tend to be a bit more critical than the average person, however some things are inexcusable when it comes to service, and sadly we didn't have the best experience. Once our party completely arrived, we were greeted by our server, a 40-something woman who seemed quite friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered a plethora of different drinks from the cocktail menu, hoping to feel as if we were on a Bahamas vacation, sipping Daquari's and Pina Coladas. I ordered the frozen banana concoction and my friend ordered a Pina Colada. Honestly, even seated right next to the bar, it took 15 minutes to get our drinks. With 3 bartenders working, this seemed somewhat unacceptable. Making matters worse, we watched the frozen drinks sit at the service bar for 10 minutes, only to melt before our very eyes before the server was able to bring them to the table. Then, upon delivering my drink, the server doesn't know which drink is the banana beverage and which is the pina colada, so she LITERALLY puts the drink up to her nostrils to smell it. I've never seen anything so bizzare in my life. It was really disgusting, and then after she wasn't able to determine which drink it was, she placed it in front of my friend, claiming it was the Pina Colada. It wasn't. So, we signal over the server to alert her of the situation. She then goes to the bartender, returns to tell us that what she made us was indeed a Pina Colada. I'm not one to argue, but I know the difference between Banana and Coconut/Pineapple. Rather than challenging the intelligence of the guest, just remake the drink properly without question. So she agreed to. 15 MINUTES LATER, she stops to pass by the table to alert me that "I need to go get some Pineapple". So the bar doesn't have Pineapple. This strikes me as odd. A bar serving Pina Colada's doesn't have Pineapple. So basically, you knowingly gave the wrong drink to the table because you knew you ran out of an item and failed to tell the guests. 10 minutes later, "So I have some bad news, we're out of Pineapple". So my friend orders a Strawberry Daquari. 10 MORE min. pass, and a MGR. brings over another drink but guess what! It's the banana drink! So the olution to rectify the problem was to give my friend a random drink he didn't order? What if he didn't like Banana (not the point, but still). Amazingly, 5 minutes later, the Strawberry Daquiri shows up. Do the math. It took an hour to get one drink right. Also, I asked for a Rum Punch (or something similar, since they have over 200 Rums). Server replied, "Lots of people have been asking but we don't have a Rum Punch". Strange. Guess what the 2nd item on the late-night drink menu? Rum Punch.....  I will say the apps were INCREDIBLE. I highly recommend the Spicy Tuna Tacos and the Jamaican Beef Patties. Very authentic and fresh ingredients. At this point, I'm willing to forgive the lack of service because the food was that good. The entrees were excellent as well, as the Cuban sandwich was a hit. I did hear them say they ran out of rice at one point, which seems odd.   I feel that if we possibly had a different server, our experience would have been different. But for a semi casual restaurant dinner with 7 friends to take 3 hours seems ridiculous. I will return this Summer, but for now 3 STARS.

0Msa6HYI89jBYJR8CIYvPQ.text: I have come here at least 5 times and every time it is delicious. If you like fried chicken, their sandwich  is my favorite. The slaw, pickle and juicy chicken is make up a giant portion! It's crispy and melts in your mouth. The fries that come with it are crispy and the ketchup/sauces are well seasoned. A must restaurant!

QvKl4f26yfTNU4SfvXKqwg.text: Let me preface this by saying that this place is actually very good - I haven't had a bad drink or dish, the service is good, the overall ambiance is very nice.   After several trips here, though, I just can't give it 5 stars because of the value factor.   Now, I realize that value isn't really what they are going for here, but I do feel like a restaurant should strive to be in the ballpark of a balance between price and product offered.   Their food is elevated - so I expect to pay more and don't mind doing it.   What I do mind is feeling like everything on their menu is 10-15% higher than it should be for what it is.     For example, let's examine the smoked pineapple guacamole appetizer.   It's absolutely delicious and beautifully presented, but it's unbalanced and they know it.  There are 8 chips.  Eight.  The chips are special - not your standard corn tortilla, but still...   They actually tell you there aren't enough chips when you order it and recommend that you get 2 orders if you are trying to share.   Not sure how that solves the balance problem exactly, but I can't bring myself to spend $24 on two scoops of guac and 16 chips.  It's special, but not THAT special.  With a few exceptions, much of their food offerings fall into this category.  Cocktails and wine are also pretty pricey.  Not insanely overpriced, but generally a buck of two above what they should be for what they are.    The other thing is that they added gratuity (20%) for our party of 6.  Although I have been a server and understand this practice to some degree, I also am offended by it as a customer.  Tips are earned, not assumed.  I tip based on the service provided and frequently tip more than 20%.  This server actually did a very good job, so she actually shorted herself in the end by assuming that I wouldn't tip appropriately.     So in the end, I guess the moral of the story is that if you want a good meal with a twist of something special, this is the place....but expect to pay for it.

o-GTEE1aYizgnS7SOWgFyA.text: The atmosphere and the customer service was amazing. The staff was very nice and was able to tend to our needs quickly. The issue I had with this restaurant is that it describes itself as a carribean restaurant and being carribean myself, it just wasn't there. I ordered the Jaimaican Jerk Chicken, which I was expecting to be moist and savory, this was not the case. The chicken was very dry and almost seemed as though it was merely fried with a dry rub. The rice was mushy, which is not the consistency carribean rice and beans have. The only thing that I did enjoy was the Jaimaican Beef Patty, which was delicious and had all the flavors I was expecting in a patty; otherwise, the meal was sub-par. I will not be returning.

6UZ3xIm0q5DjWcn6L2FbwQ.text: The food was phenomenal. Authentic tacos that taste great. Staff was very friendly. I recommend this restaurant.

8doLWuxjo2y4Xfqwv1rtMA.text: Stopped by on a whim after a night out. Had a couple of beers at the bar where we were also able to eat. Shared a cubano sandwich and fries. Wow wow wow. That sandwich had so much flavor and juice just bursting in our mouths. It was like a food extravaganza on my tongue. I'm happy to have such a place and can't wait to get back and try other options.

c30shPcmoJbJ-W3MMm7Chw.text: So in love with this place. We decided to skip our dinner reservations and just turn our late lunch into a multi hour excursion once we sat down here. We had a couple pitchers of the Bruja to drink, and split the smoked pineapple guacamole, the pollo frito sandwich with sides of tostones and plantains, and the tres leches cake to wrap it up. Everything was so good!! The smoked pineapple guac came with two kinds of chips, the pollo frito sandwich was super good although less jerk flavored than we thought it would be. The coleslaw on top had golden raisins and pepitas, which I was not expecting but wasn't mad at all. We may have ordered a second order of the plantains because they were so good. We didn't finish the watermelon mojito popsicle because it was just eh (the liquor separated from the ice), but everything else was fantastic.   The atmosphere was great, really cool interior design, and our waitress was good! She wasn't sure what some things were on the menu, but she went out of her way to find out and we felt she was attentive; the bartender was the only questionable person here. We watched him hit on a woman who was there with her husband and brag about his sex life. It was uncomfortable to watch; and really, anyone could've made these drinks. Aside from him though, the staff were all great, and we will definitely be back next time we're in Pittsburgh!

lvSc2SoB5FGKD9L9PhDSmQ.text: I am a tough grader and this is my favorite bar and restaurant in Pittsburgh! Why? Simple: 1. They have over 200 different kinds of rum. You can get Don Q from Puerto Rico, Brugal from the Dominican Republic, Abuelo from Panama . . . . . and those are just some of my favorites . . . . 2. The Caribbean food is absolutely awesome. I've taken a lot of people there, both for business and pleasure. We've never had something we didn't like. Not a single item! Some of my favorite items are tostones, black bean soup, all the empanadas, and the frita sliders. But feel free to order anything you like on the menu, you'll love it. SECRET MENU ITEM -- If you go on a day when they are not going crazy, ask them to make you an "El Jibarito" sandwich. As of this writing, they have not put this on the menu; although they are considering making it a standard menu item. Either way, you can thank me later . . . . - Sal Sal Acosta Cell Ph: 484-358-9470 linkedin.com/in/SalAcosta LandonAndAcosta.com

Of1MUR90W2mNoDP8Ufegsw.text: Found this place walking through pittsburgh looking for brunch with Vegan options. Upon finding out that we were vegan, the chef and staff offered to let us try an experimental option he had been thinking of rolling out to the main menu: A smoked jackfruit taco with pickled strawberries in a beet corn shell. I really enjoyed it: a very unique combination of sharp and spicy flavors I certainly haven't had else where. My only two critiques are:   1. I wish the jackfruit was more meat-like in texture. Because it was smoked, and not seared, it had a nice smokey flavor but was still soft like fruit. 2. More savory flavors. The combination of strawberries and house made mango habenaro salsa made this taco unusually sweet, almost dessert like.   We also had a vegetable empanada with house made pesto sauce and some fried plantains. The empanada was perfectly fried, and the pesto sauce accompanied it well. I like stronger flavors in general, and so I did note that the empanada was a bit flat. Fried plantains were sweet and light. Overall both were delicious with great texture.   Staff was friendly and personal. Would definitely recommend. Will come again.

QgvgVzsRaK5M8noBpHSpaQ.text: So, I had wanted to try this cool Carribbean concept restaurant for quite some time now, and the opportunity came up to enjoy it with my brother on a guys' night out with the Joe Bonamassa concert last week. We read the menu and some of the reviews, and were really excited for our experience. It's conveniently located by the PPG plaza on Forbes, and there's lots to do around that area.  Reservations were a snap - they have a link on their website, and it's super easy. The front of the house staff were very friendly when I texted them (while stuck at a standstill in dahntahn traffic - there was a Pens game, after all) and said it was no problem, and thanks for letting us know.  I was greeted with a warm smile and pleasant, courteous service by the hostess when I arrived, and she showed me my table in the back room, where Cutthroat Island was playing on a big screen TV. The music in the room was a bit on the loud side, but that seems to be popular these days in many newer restaurants, so I didn't mention it. Soon enough, the manager came in and lowered the decibels, much to our happiness.  So, initially service seemed good, and our server came in and did a good job taking orders for drinks and appetizers, always being patient and friendly. I don't know if he was just new or what, but he had a hard time when we asked him what his favorite things were - he basically would recite the whole menu. No big deal, we just like it when the wait staff will give us the real low-down on things like this, without trying to over-sell a dish.  This place is more of a bar that happens to also sell food, so keep that in mind if you are going to visit. It was hopping at the bar. I loved my drink, which was well-balanced and delicious. My brother's was too. Beer choices are good too.  Now, on to the food... The appetizers were OK - especially the cod fritters. The tuna soft tacos were just OK, but not spicy at all (they are advertised as spicy...) - somewhat bland. I would probably add in a little Carribbean flavor, because they were pretty bland. We ordered a Cuban sandwich and the fried whole Snapper. Big mistake. First, it took an eon for our food to arrive. We were done with our appetizers for 15-20 minutes before the main deal arrived. I understand that the kitchen can get backed up, but we just sat there, and nobody asked us if we wanted another drink or if they could check on things - it was nice to talk to my brother and all, but we were hungry!  The Cuban sandwich should be avoided at all costs. I've enjoyed many down in Miami, so I think I have an idea of what a good one tastes like - this was not it. Actually, it was essentially flavorless and tough. The sliced pork loin had absolutely not one molecule of umami. I'm not sure I would have been able to tell what it was if I were having it in a blind taste test. The ham in the sandwich wasn't far behind. The cheese (gruyere) tasted like brick cheese and not a tangy, flavorful gruyere. In fact, the only thing I could really taste were the pickles - too bad this wasn't a pickle sandwich. I didn't like the bread much, and there was a lot of it. We make lots of panini at home, and this bread was just horribly dense - I think all the air had been pressed out of it in the panini press.  The fried whole snapper tasted like a steamed fish, and it didn't have much flavor at that. While I love steamed fish, I prefer seasoned steamed fish much better - this just didn't have ANY seasoning that was discernible. The consistency was great, so I think it's a simple fix - might be cool to have a sauce on the side to give the fish a little help, because it was bland, sort of like the fish my grandparents had to eat on a cardiac-healthy diet.  Now the real disappointment were the tostones - I typically like them a lot. These, not so much. They came out pretty cold and overly solid - these were not the sweet, tangy warm tostones I have come to love elsewhere. I don't know if they just sat on the line too long or what. I wouldn't brave them again. The yucca isn't much better.  I will say that the Executive Chef came out to check on us in the back (interestingly, he only came to our table, not the other three that were seated) right as we got started - I wonder if he was worried about what had been served. It's hard to change once you've started, though. Folks in the kitchen in many places don't much care for diners who send their food back.  All of these things said, I think the place is trying hard. I bet it would be a home run if they would shrink the menu just a little bit and perhaps focus on a Caribbean "tapas" concept, since the bar is so popular - this would give folks the opportunity to try lots of little dishes that would be able to be served hot and fresh while they enjoy the incredible drink menu. I just think that the current concept may be extraordinarily challenging to execute. I'll give it some more time - maybe we'll try again in a few months...

TI0w1rgABQipyDaVh-xAVg.text: Great Food, Excellent Service!!! My first visit to Pirata, and definitely not my last.  I visited on a Monday night, the restaurant wasn't very busy, so I sat at the bar to take advantage of Happy Hour!  The bartender approached me right away, and was super friendly throughout my entire visit.  I ordered a sangria, smoked pineapple salsa (happy hour portion, yay!), a chicken empanada and the Cuban sandwich with fries.  The sangria was EXCELLENT, the real deal, not just wine with fruit.  The pineapple salsa and empanada were also very tasty.  The salsa was fresh, smoky and sweet, definitely different from anything that I had before.  The empanada,was flaky and flavorful.  The star of the show was the Cuban sandwich, layers of ham, pork, swiss cheese, on real Cuban bread....yum.  The sandwich was huge, I only ate half, and saved the rest for lunch the next day, and it was even better!.  This was a great meal, can't wait to return.

d7PP1WE2mRtvD1TO3sPMJQ.text: Amazing establishment! We sat down before a concert and were greeted right away. Made it for happy hour, had great drinks and fresh chips and salsas. Tacos were amazing, booming with flavors. Still sitting here now, very happy with this business! Will definitely be back again!

i8zDA704M2DQ7xWnlrAWqg.text: We had the smoked pineapple guac with fried plantain for an app. For lunch we had empanadas and jerked chicken.  All the food was excellent.  For dessert we had the rum bread pudding. It was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empty mojito.  Karen loved it!

AmuiW6PJLyqT2fAeDkomOQ.text: The atmosphere was awesome it's stylish and unique with relaxed island feels. We split coconut shrimp and cod fritters to start. The shrip were huge! I had the jerk chicken entree and it was amazing. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our server was great and explained all the heat levels in the dishes. I love spicy food and was pleasantly suprised when we received two house hot sauces to go with our meals. The drinks were great and arrived with style, my friends beverage came in a skull glass and looked incredible. 10/10 would return. SO MUCH RUM!

Zqzz1PVegO1HP9HqYUM3Kg.text: The atmosphere of this place blew me away. Strolling into Pirata. There's art on the wall that is a huge painting that is awesome. The staff is super attentively and always made sure my glass was full. I tried the cod fritters. They were spicier than I thought but enjoyable and I got six of them. We also tried the jerk chicken tacos. I didn't really care for the fixings in the tacos but I saw where it was going. I'll most definitely come back to try other things on the menu. I can't believe it took me so long to stroll into this place. I'm also excited that their menu has a variety. I don't eat beef or pork and these guys had other options.
