xjFU6eCFAaSHjK0l98ow7A.text: Excellent tasty food, super service (did get there a little before the noon rush), a little disappointed in my portion size (jerked chicken Ritos) but my friends Cuban sandwich was nice sized with a BIG mound of fries. Definitely $$$ but a nice treat.

-xwM9HYMpeV6LO02I4yTIw.text: The deep fried empanada is the best!!! Tres leches cake so yummy !!! I will go back and try more from the menu!

_iYYlm9sxa-_QCidH4rCBg.text: First, the yelp app to make a reservation isn't working.  It will tell you there are no reservations available, when there is availability.  Second, you must go and try this place.  The smoked pineapple guac was amazing!  The shrimp entree with polenta was excellent.  We even loved the Mahi mahi encrusted with plantains.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Truly authentic Caribbean food.  I understand a chef from Miami is flying in monthly to create the menu.  It was a wonderful meal.  We will be back.

FioPjFeHYBkFsN7_nixQxg.text: After just returning from Cuba- I have been jonesing for an authentic Cuban mojito. I've found it - as well as the best tamarind dried glazed chicken wings in the entire world- think cilantro yogurt dipping sauce. A must go for any foodie!

IokBjZ28n5GmnLL3Jf0QJg.text: Third visit, looks like the place is firing on all cylinders. Good vibe and tunes along with a good, varied selection of small plates. Smart, friendly service on a warm February weekend night. Try the avocado and heirloom salad with crab cakes for a good Caribbean theme though bunuelos bacalao and Tempranillo is never a bad, yet simple, choice for the more European minded!

bOYNr1w2VEuDiN3WdUTEdw.text: Visiting Pittsburgh downtown, walked right in and got a table. The tacos were very delicious. They were very full. I would recommend pairing them with an empanada. Great music playing. Service was very good.

TsRoPN6AZvswWcIDh3i1xA.text: Nice set up and ambiance. However, as a Caribeno, and being well acquainted with Caribbean food, I was disappointed. First off, $4 for a palm sized empanada? The picadillo had no raisins in it as it traditionally should and there was no taste of onions, sofrito or tomato paste. Very bland. Secondly, the "jerk" chicken is just oven baked chicken with Walkerwoods jerk wet rub on it (not house made). Not marinated. No bueno. The "smoked" guacamole had bacon in it, which wasn't mentioned on the menu, and should be considered for people who don't eat pork. The ox tail was the MOST fatty I've ever had. And I grew up on ox tail. The whole dish was corn meal, beans, bone and fat. For $26? You're better off going to Leon's Caribbean or Royal Caribbean for oxtail, more meat and $13 cheaper.

cNvSabfIICz1POixO3pIWg.text: This was our second stop on our bar tour last night.   The bartender was super friendly and knew how to make a drink.   The bar was pretty busy and everyone seemed to be enjoying the atmosphere.  But I must say of all the places we went last night it was the most expensive.   Two drinks were $26 and neither were top shelf.   We may return to try the food but won't be drinking in this establishment.

41jo6-B-C6p3Ozm6h0utfA.text: Decided to go out for a nice family dinner since my mother had come down to visit. We were enjoying everything. The food was delicious and the server was nice but then several hours later things began going down hill. My mother began vomiting and running to the bathroom, then my grandmother, then my 8yr old, then my 5 year old, then me, then my husband and lastly my 1yr old. Im 6 months pregnant & had to stay up all night with sweats & intense cramps. God forbid something were to happen to my unborn baby. I spent the entire morning trying to take care of husband & 1 yr old since things set in for them around 5am. Having to watch my child scream & vomit several times was obviously not enjoyable. Was supppsed to take my kids to a birthday party that they had been waiting all month to go to but we are all stuck at home trying to recover. Im so disappointed that such a great night took a turn for the worst. I never thought this would happen to me as I have never had food poisoning before especially while carrying a baby :( Thankfully some of us are beginning to feel better but we sure will not be recommending this establishment to anyone. I hope this did not occur to anyone else or to anyone in the future.

ixrec1fjr-BD5D6vJiNiLQ.text: Great time at pirata.  Excellent cocktail options.  Suggest the dark and stormy made to your taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chilling at Pirata.

Ai93qsELOf4VnGXvU_QTbg.text: Had the jerk chicken and the bartender recommended a really nice rum. Staff was very nice and the food... Oh the food... So good. Surprised at the fairly reasonable prices also, will definitely return.

VDhDOQ157JrTR2LwWq-X6Q.text: This place is great. Cool atmosphere and really good food. They also have an interesting drink selection and rum flights - so can't go wrong with that!

0N-gpEj-0zOjqu_Zm3Z4vg.text: A friend and I had lunch at Pirata because we wanted to try something new.  It wasn't crowded, but the service was absolutely horrible!  The waitress got our orders wrong -- even though we asked several questions about the jerk chicken roti and pointed to it on the menu. She never asked if we wanted anything to drink, and overcharged us.  I ate the food that was delivered, my friend requested what she/we originally ordered.  My jerk chicken entree should have been cooked a bit more, the rice and beans were dry, but the greens were tender and flavorful. My chicken was not undone, but was not tender. I understand that it's a newly opened restaurant but if you want repeat customers, you should strive to provide excellent service. This was not even decent.  I will not be returning or recommending Pirata as a good place to eat.

vs1eT3rYdq-a575actEBOg.text: My friend and I came for the late night menu. The food wasn't bad. The service left much to be desired. After we were sat by the hostess, we waited ten minutes to see our waitress. After she took our drink orders it took another 20 minuets to get our waters and our drinks. We waited another 15 to place our food order and then 30min to even receive our food. In the first hour that we were there we saw our waitress maybe two times. She didn't come in and check how our food or drinks were. When she finally came back around I ordered another drink and some more food that took another 25-30 min. My drinks were not consistent, I ordered the rum punch, and we got the rest of the food packed up to go because it was taking so long to arrive. Our total meal time took around 2 hours, and we saw our waitress maybe three times. The food wasn't bad but the service left me wanting more.

bRcWvvqa-bG3WdZCYTstBA.text: Went Pirata after work with a group of friends.  Impressed with the atmosphere and service.  The host and server were very friendly and accommodating.  The cocktails were decent but pricey.  They also do not have any post-work happy hour specials.  The food dishes were very disappointing, small, and over-priced.  The pork belly rotis was mostly fat.  The tuna tartare in the St. Bart's tacos was hot pink fluff.  It did not remotely look like traditional tuna tartare.  Unsatisfied by the food, we passed on a second round of drinks, got our checks, and left to get dinner elsewhere.

Yq9pUcCq-eiru6cVRYUFyQ.text: First time visitor. In town for light up night. GREAT CUBAN AAND RUM!!! Thanks a ton Bob and Jason!

PQiuuH5zKs0ixNA2jaFxKQ.text: Writing a review here and elsewhere because it's worthy. A fairly large group of us went to Pirata, most for the first time. We had a mix of ages and backgrounds and tastes. By night's end we all agreed that this is one special restaurant.  Two of us had mahi tacos, which were reminiscient of the mouth watering ones my wife and I once had in Fort Lauderdale.   Two had fried grouper. I was afforded a taste and concurred with the diners that it was spectacular.  Moist yet fully cooked. Done just right and flavorful. I can't recall all the others (9 or 10 went) but all loved the food. Needless to say we had to try the rum. The rum flights are so worth it. I had 2 and was finding all to be good. I erred in ordering a VERY costly highly aged rum, and the manager was the epitome of gracious and kindly took it back since I hadn't tasted it. Holly was our server, and she too was a pleasure, like everything else. From the greeting as we walked in till we left, the entire staff was very pleasant and attentive. We all agreed we are DEFINITELY going back!

Q-lcTJ_LgWL-3QxNGmVnWw.text: What can I say? I was treated like la familia. Chef Juan and team greeted me and my girlfriend with open arms. Service was very prompt with plenty of seating options available, well for the time being. Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and drinks. The food, where do I start? If you order anything and close your eyes you're saving a lot on a trip to the keys or islands. This is the most authentic you can get to island cooking anywhere around Pittsburgh. Would be very hard pressed to find a person to disagree.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

at-VWWLkqa4Yok2QKW6m6Q.text: If Pirata was not on your must visit list, add it NOW!  I know food...this was top notch throughout the whole dining experience from the food to the service and atmosphere.  We chose the restaurant specially because of the unique menu but were surprised that we got right in without a long wait.  We visited During the first Saturday Brunch and it was nothing short of spectacular.  Definitely try the Chorizo tacos with fried egg, Larso Tacos and ALL of the empanadas, each was spectacular but our favorite was the Jamaican beef patty with a perfect blend of Caribbean spices. We had the opportunity to try the watermelon honey salad and ceviche trio that were both out of this world.  The Chef Josh and Bob one of the owners stopped by and gave us great insights into the inspiration to the restaurant and history that made our visit very special.   Lastly the bartenders were kind and unique and made this a really great place to spend an afternoon as a visitor in Pittsburgh, thank you!

Gzea89NAq5SIa3461krVsw.text: Happened to luck into this being located right beside our hotel. Beautiful decor and wonderful drinks. We did not eat but they did have some Vegetarian and vegan option available which looked yummy. We loved it that on the big screens they were showing old pirate movies!

gCs06h0L0EJXvW9946fGmA.text: Ordered for pick up and was very quick. Got the jerk chicken tacos and a beef paddy.  Warning..the yellow sauce that comes with the tacos is super spicy, apply with caution.  The flavor great for both.    A bit on the small side for the paddy and only two tacos, I am used to getting three for a normal taco order.

1fC3qw2I1y8uJdAX6UPxoA.text: This is my new favorite in Pittsburgh when I am here on business, they have my favorite beer from the Dominican Republic and the yucca fries are almost as good as the one I got in Venezuela. Heading back tomorrow to try the black bean soup and empanadas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yucca fries were awesome, they did however need a little more authentic sauce.
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

J0PYODWEdVbZjcjH6jhMqg.text: Easily made reservations for a Saturday at 6:30 for a party of 4. Automated text messages the day and a half an hour before to confirm/remind reservation time.   Arrived early, our table was ready but we asked to sit at the bar for a while to wait for our friends/grab a drink. Nice drink menu! Lots of rum, cocktails, wine and beer selections. Among our group we had the Mojito Royals, Mutiny on the Bounty, the Caribbean Julep and the house red. Everything was great - but the Caribbean Julep was overloaded with ice and was difficult to drink.   After a drink we decided to go to our table, where we waited probably 10 minutes for our waitress to arrive. Not a huge deal, but we didn't have drinks (water or alcoholic) so it was a bit annoying. When she did arrive she was pleasant and helpful. We ordered drinks (just the house red/white) and the Cuban Sandwich Bites and Pineapple Guacamole for starters. Loved them!  Each couple shared two varieties of the Caribbean Rotis: pork belly and jerk chicken. Warning! The jerk chicken is spicy. You get to taco-like tortillas with each order and it's convenient for sharing. The pork belly was awesome with the mashed plantains. We also got an order of the Jamaican street corn (off the cob in a crock) and it was AMAZING. Along with the tostones and sweet plantains we loved our food.   I would have no problem returning or recommending this restaurant to a friend. Definitely a good spot to meet with friends for drinks/small bites or a meal for date night. 4 stars for slower service after seating and an overload of ice in the julep.

BJKurDDgE0EgZpBLDcxdsw.text: I wish this was open later as it was next to my hotel and not much else was going on. The education about rums, their country of origins and flavor notes was as good as the food.  A definitely great find for a road warrior.  Their jerk chicken tacos were as desired for a taco lover. In particular they offer really innovative hot sauces with mango base, pineapple base, and one other i can't remember. Very different and really interesting and satisfying.

Q3e6HUGwGQX6ubzY-nmcnQ.text: Without a doubt one of Downtown Pittsburgh's best kept secrets, after 4 years living here I'd say hands down best cocktails in the city. Tacos + old fashion are my personal favorites on the menu

4A6Kvy7fcbyEyfLeQp4jhw.text: The drinks were amazing. So tasty but a little pricey. I had the jerk chicken tacos which were really flavorful. Also got an order of the tostones. This was really the only thing that disappointed. They were bland and dry. Needed something more than the creamy mild sauce that came with them.

HoOiPROfSNxlu2jjI3mEoA.text: No really- FOUR STARS average?! Where are you people going? Did I miss the portal past the saddest rum bar ever and into some future rum den where service isn't shitty, music isn't painful, and drinks aren't damn near undrinkable?! Oh dahn town you break my heart. To be fair we were here late and maybe everyone had just given up hope. Fair, as all mine is lost as well.

yQXBoIIQebreg373wkKLrQ.text: Excellent cocktails, amazing rum selection, and delicious food.   The Pineapple daiquiri was a very traditional daiquiri made with a pineapple rum that was very faithful with a little extra sweetness.   The Zombie flight was 3 full sized cocktail variations using 3 different version of the recipe. All 3 were very good and different from each other.   The empanadas were out of this world outstanding.   Great place, great atmosphere. Cannot wait toncom

TpfYs5QPMmoZOcn9UBQIZw.text: Stopped in for dinner here on a business trip - the majority of the people seemed to be there for drinks so there quite a loud and boisterous atmosphere.   The hostess and wait staff were excellent. I had three to four people constantly checking in on me. The food was amazing - I ordered the jerk chicken. It was very spicy but a True jerk chicken. Also had the rice and beans and a side of tostones. All very good and their house made sauces are excellent. If you're in downtown Pittsburgh this place is a must. My only recommendation would be to skip it if you're looking for a quieter place for dinner.

CRotisHORtAsiouiRwtmng.text: For tiki drinks and Caribbean food this place is can't miss. Friendly staff and a great happy hour. The sliders are particularly great and you can't go wrong with the 1950 zombie.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

K7dzlkIJVHDVI6hvWaHexA.text: Great food,  I had the Cuban sandwich here and loved it!  I was impressed by how hot the sandwich stayed the whole time I was eating it and it was a very generous portion as well.   The only thing to be cautious of, there were six of us dining and they added 20% gratuity to the bill before taxes.  I know some restaurants do this but I didn't see anything on the menu that told you this nor did our waitress inform us of this.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dark and Stormy with Black Seal Rum!

RfLH7p4vOhFykzpDZ9NAzw.text: First things first, those drinks were so good. Service was great and the overall ambiance is well designed. The food was good in general (ordered jerk chicken tacos and octopus escabeche), although the chicken tacos didn't have crispy enough chicken and the octopus was not as fresh as I would have hoped. Now back to the drinks. The bartender was very helpful and cute. Ordered the walking dead cocktail (delicious) and also an off-menu espresso martini with rum that was really, really well made, deliciously full bodied and rich. Seriously, I want more... but til next time. Definitely would like to come back here again for a happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The refreshing walking dead (front) and a delicious espresso martini (back).
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very delicious jerk chicken tacos
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Octopus escabeche. Good flavor profile but the octopus wasn&#39;t as fresh as I would have liked

w_DS0Hg9J-1PS4bc_1u4jw.text: Awesome, tropical cocktails plus INSANE rum selection. And the food is unbelievably good. Both the jerk chicken and skirt steak tacos were delicious, as were the housemade hot sauces. And the sweet plantains were sooo good! Nice waiter, quick and not too crowded but still a good energy.

CVO_meKZr5qlUG58-sXbXQ.text: Last night my husband and I stopped at Pirata before the Pens game. We were seated immediately. The decor is nice and it really makes you feel like you are somewhere other than Pittsburgh. The staff was immediately friendly and welcoming and ready to take care of us.   We ordered the banana walnut old fashioned and the rum punch. Both had a great smooth flavor and the old fashioned was unique and not very overwhelming on the banana flavor. As it turns out, our waitress let us know they infuse their own rum. So the banana was not some fake syrup, but True banana.   We ordered a little of everything to get the feel of the restaurant. We started with the conch fritters. They were delicate and spiced perfectly. The dipping sauce for them was creamy and sweet with only a slight kick of heat at the end that was barely detectable. We had to wait a bit longer for this as they had to remake them, and the owner personally stopped over to apologize and took care of us the rest of the evening. Truly exceptional customer service (so important these days especially at a downtown establishment!).   For the main course we got the empanadas, yuca fries, and tacos. Everything was delightful! The empanadas were filling and tasty. Each with a different dough and filling. The dipping sauces complimented them perfectly. They were a decent size as well. My husband devoured the tacos and the waitress let us know they marinate the meat for 12 hours to make sure it is extra tender.   I think they have over 250 rums to try so we will definitely be back to sample more.

l0ZRoQB1hOxMcFYoTNZmug.text: I am overall pretty impressed with Pirata. Once you walk in, you catch a really cool vibe - nice Caribbean atmosphere! Really impressive rum selection as well too! I Really enjoyed getting to read each part of the menu and was very happy with the entire selection!  I am a True sucker for Caribbean food, and I this place has hooked me!

GvehE1jNY1pQJHw0bvB7Wg.text: I spent my Black Friday downtown and stopped by for a late lunch. I sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and helpful, without being nebby.  I'm not usually a fan of themed restaurants, but I was thinking about a prior trip to St. Thomas and hoped it would let me escape dreary Pittsburgh. It didn't disappoint.   Spiked ginger beer and amazing conch fritters. I could've stopped there and died happy. Is it allowed to say that the conch fritters were better than the ones I get in the Caribbean? The mustard is great, but the new hot sauce was out of this world. Bottle that and sell it, at least to me.   I had beef tacos that were just ok. They have stiff competition from Tako and Bakersfield, which I love, so I'm not sure that I would have them again. They weren't bad, just nothing as special as the fritters.   I wrapped it up with the flan. Itwas a nice consistency and if you like really sweet desserts (I do), it won't disappoint. I will definitely be back. It hasn't been open long, so you should all go give it a shot and welcome them to Pittsburgh.

POwSNRXhwQqeX9OhNgix_g.text: A group of my friends and I went on a Saturday night for the bar menu. The concept was fun with decor to match. I definitely recommend the empanadas & ham and cheese croquettes. Drinks are strong - the rum and cocktail flights are $15 for 3 drinks and well worth it.   There was a DJ but the music was random and generic. I'd recommend a more upbeat DJ or just sticking with a pre-made playlist, depending on what vibe the restaurant is going for. We were concerned we'd need reservations but found there were plenty of open seats.

buCVRk2L-xMFXDtTCN-fRQ.text: Fun atmosphere and the room is well insulated so you don't have to yell to have a conversation. The flights are a great bargain (we did the zombie one which is basically three full size drinks for $18). Empanadas with dipping sauce are also delicious and only $3.00. The steak tacos were bad though... meat wasn't great quality and they were dripping grease.  The bartender had a warm personality and was very efficient. A disabled man also came in while we were there and the staff was very accommodating without being overbearing which is always nice to see. The bar is  right in the front so you have to fight your way through people to get to the dining area but they did the best job there could with the space.  I would definitely return for the flights and empanadas!

uJv3W6CI8-GHIdCayQWIDQ.text: We only came in for drinks and ended up getting an education on rum. The bartenders were extremely informative and allowed us a number of tastes to find what we liked. A nice sized bar that will allow for groups of people.

hXJBq5yiaZphwenqO47A4w.text: This carribean-themed restaurant boasts too many types of rum to count, along with offerings ranging from Mahi fish tacos to Cuban sandwiches.  Service is friendly and knowledgeable, and they offer a plush, private room for larger parties.

CPCZ1qZ5uZrh2BdOaJhL6w.text: The theme is a Rum bar. It's decor is not anything special. Stopped in for a drink.  I had a Imperial Lager which was good. My friend had a Mojito which seems to be a house specialty. She said it was good. The bartender was attentive and introduced himself when we arrived.  Overall a nice place to grab a drink and maybe a bite. I'll stop again when I have more time.

6zqttN1QZd313cqaAvsEgQ.text: Really good spot.  I was there early for some drinks and some food.  If rum is your drink, this is the place for you. Not the Pina colada or Malibu rum. The rum o am talking about is the aged rum.  They have a wide selection.  I just had the jerk chicken tacos and they were delicious.  The service was great and the bartenders were fun.

1cf0lMxu32jmtCCpK-5teQ.text: This place was pretty good. Came in for lunch. Had the jerk chicken tacos. I was surprised for the price they did not come with a side of any kind, and were two really small tacos. There are so many places to get good tacos downtown, maybe I should have ordered something else.   I ended up ordering red beans and rice which was delicious. I thought the tacos were very salty, almost unbearably salty, but then there was this mango relish which was very sweet. Just thought the flavor combinations were a little off.   Our waitress seemed inconvenienced when my colleague asked for some rice with her black bean soup. It was lunch, it was not busy...  Overall just a weird experience, not sure I'd run back. Did like that they were playing reggae, and the decor was pretty cool.

Zdzgr7945EnQL8wK7q_50Q.text: The food is good here. I did enjoy the beef patty. It's had a nice flavor to it. I ordered the jerk chicken which was good. I am used to a spicy flavor and this was a lot milder but it was still good. I would definitely come back to try something else.

XC2KrPyfi9IaSMqqBRwq3w.text: Warning happy hour is only at the bar. And the prices are half off too. The staff failed to mention that. So when our group sat at the bar waiting for our table we saw the prices and kept ordering those things thinking it was the same throughout the resturant. Come to get our bill and it was triple than what we thought. Talked to the owner who was very rude and said that it's only at the bar. Even though it doesn't state that and told us that we haven't been to any good restaurants, because only the good ones only happy hour at the bar. Well they lost us as customers. We will find where these good restaurants are.

jBQ_kk-UtvlPW3mVfX1Xbg.text: Light up night highlight was a duck into the Caribbean for dinner.  Despite the packed house around the bar, we were seated immediately and greeted with a personable server with a thorough knowledge of the menu.  We waited a shade too long for our drinks, but they were served with an apology due to the crowded bar.  We chose black bean soup, which comes in a generous bowl, authentic empanadas, a grouper (yes grouper!) taco, and a perfectly-dressed salad full mixed greens, olives, and grilled cheese cubes.  While we had wine and beer, their cocktail menu beats Caribbean with creative combinations.  Despite not having been open for that long, the restaurant provided a well-orchestrated dining experience with great food, great service, and a lively atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ITRmvHfN4VAnjmO0J_VMQA.text: Stopped in with my family for a random Monday lunch. Service was prompt and super friendly! Our waitress was very enthusiastic about the menu. We shared a few apps (smoked pineapple guac and tuna tartar tacos - both delicious) and had a round of drinks. The banana walnut old fashioned drink was amazing. Naturally, I tried everyone else's drinks, too. They were all delicious and the prices were fair for good drinks downtown.   We mostly ordered lunch sandwiches. They were very generously portioned and super tasty. It was refreshing to enjoy authentic Caribbean flavors. You have to ask for their house papaya hot sauce. It was hot, but soooo so good.   Will definitely be back again. Such a little gem downtown with a good atmosphere. Also worth mentioning, the gorgeous comfortable chairs and nice big tables. Too many downtown spots are crammed and uncomfortable.

CgSW7IcGMC4yi8SQCBeQmg.text: Anytime I wake up to a grey gloomy Pittsburgh day I come here. Maybe it's the reggae playing but the staff is always so awesome and welcoming. I highly recommend their Sandia y honey salad!! It's like vacation in your mouth. Also their jackfruit tacos are out of this world!! Grateful to have this tastebud paradise right in market square

hj_Z3W3NnkcGPhF_E0McCg.text: We came here after seeing a 2:00 show at the Benedum. We had a 6:30 reservation and arrived a bit early ( after having a coffee and glass of wine at Market St.) but were seated promptly in the rear. It is a fun space, with Caribbean music in the background and a themed movie on the big screen ( on our visit it was  "Muppets Treasure Island "). Our waitress was kind and willing to share her opinions; we were, however, surprised at the amount of time it took to get our drinks. My husband had the Around the World  rum flight, and I had their Manhattan. He enjoyed the rum and my drink was slightly sweet for a manhattan but enjoyable nonetheless.   As a meal, I ordered the dry rub jerk wings and collard greens, and my husband the goat tacos and mac and cheese. We split an order of the fries, and after seeing the size of the portions also ordered the pork belly tacos to share. The food was good, yet, as noted, the portions were small for the price. The tacos come in twos with minimal fillings (much smaller than nearby Tako) and the collards and mac and cheese were in very small cast iron skillets. The wings had an excellent flavor, and my husband wondered how they infused the jerk flavor beyond the skin-possibly marinated? The collards have a unique flavor; we loved the infusion of coconut milk and spice and might try to replicate it at home!  We were here on a Saturday night and by 8 many tables were free. We would like to go again, but possibly just for happy hour. We hope they continue to improve and expand their portion size. Interesting new addition to the Pittsburgh dining scene!

vs6GDdhsvBbqc9Vt7qLkdg.text: Startup...is it still a startup after 7 weeks?  Startup restaurant in an already highly competitive downtown area.    It was good, not great, so I hope it holds on because...  Some intriguing options...a rum bar with 200 varieties of rum?  I feel like this is a good idea...a rum option for the folks who have exhausted the ryes, whiskeys and wines of other spirited competition (see what I did there?  spirited?  like...spirits?).  Caribbean theme too is a bit different than the run-of-the-mill in Pittsburgh.    We sat at a high table along the wall.  The seats didn't have a foot rest, so half the people just dangled their feet off the edge of their seats like toddlers at the grown up table.  The waiter came off rude and disinterested at first but honestly, I just think he was extremely dry.  By the end of the meal we found him quite entertaining.   The manager visited our table and apologized (not that we'd complained) proactively about 'getting the kinks worked out' and explained that he was unhappy with some of the menu and decor (he indicated that the current menu is only a partial of what it ultimately will become).  And in truth, I thought the menu was a little entree light.    Cuban/Dominican/Jamaican fare...we visited on the day Castro died and I had Ropa Vieja.  It seemed fitting.  It tasted vaguely communist, but in all seriousness was again...good not great.  I thought it was well-prepared and tasty, but there's only so much you can do with skirt steak, rice, and beans.    I had a Mojito Royale which was really good, and a Golden Hind...which came across as "Kamikaze in a nice glass".  I had another drink, but I'm getting two elderly to remember what it was.  I'm cautiously optimistic about the place.  I'd like to go back and try one of the rum/cocktail flights.  That looked like fun, but wasn't really what I was looking for when we visited.  I feel like there's a place for Pirata once they get their sea legs.  I'll go back and give it another whirl.

BJ3xA1-FfynjBv_apopzsQ.text: Good Cuban & Caribbean Food!  Warm, inviting, contemporary atmosphere with good reggae tunes.

h4D3BPCfOl9pcaWuOkxiPQ.text: Worst jerk chicken I've ever eaten. As a West Indian I am deeply offended that they are serving this trash at such a high price. $18 for chicken that doesn't even remotely resemble any spices in jerk seasoning. Stay away from the Facebook recipes, and stay away from our food. You cannot replicate it. What you're doing is harmful to my culture.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Supposedly jerk chicken

MmG7ZBRKuhoMVpXsn-YhnQ.text: This place is underrated...Ahhhhmazing food and great atmosphere!!! Roasted pineapple guacamole is outstanding...blows away guac @'tako. Pollo frita and veg curry were so flavorful. Can't wait to go back!

8EpQ-2koTtL0FbcnIjq06g.text: Wow....jerk chicken with red beans and rice and collards....heaven. chicken was tender and spicy. Ask for the hot sauces theu are great too if you like real hot. The collards were in an amazing curry sauce. I can't wait to come back to try the smoked pineapple guac. The drinks are phenomenal and seriously folks, it's a rum bar!!! Try the damn rum drinks they are worth it!!! I may not be in Jamaica but this is perfect for a Caribbean fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mojito royale

s-fV1zC29tcivK2E96KUGw.text: Overall a good experience. Loved the rum flights. I had the jerk wings which were super salty. Good ambience and attentive servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pirata - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rum flights

8y82wu52RcI3b4l2K17-Pg.text: Pirata is great. I've eaten lunch a few times and have been happy each time.  The fish sandwich (Pescado Frito) is excellent, the arroz con pollo was also good. I also think I've had the ropa viejo and enjoyed it.  None of the food is very spicy. You can ask for a hot sauce made in the restaurant that is amazing. Really good heat, really good flavor.  The bar is good. I've only had the beer though, so I can't speak to any sorts of 'island' cocktails.  As a note, mention you're on a lunch break and review the menu ahead of time if you've got a deadline.

4G0iYlswRFFmc10kxYKj2Q.text: I will absolutely be back!   The place is new (just over 5 weeks) so they were still working out the kinks I think. I was here for a business lunch and it was a good spot. It's bustling but not too loud. One thing that amazed me is that even though there is not vestibule, it doesn't get freezing in the front of the restaurant when someone opens the door. The magic of architecture I guess.   The menu is small but has choices for everyone. Our waitress was knowledgeable and pointed us towards adding a side onto the tacos. While it makes a "meal" more expensive -- it's definitely necessary. The two tacos, while hearty, would not have been enough for a full lunch.   I went with the pork tacos and the mac and cheese "pie." It was an awesome choice. The tacos were phenomenal. The shell was crispy but flexible. The meat was perfectly marinated and the toppings were perfectly complimentary. The taco stayed together perfectly while eating. The mac and cheese -- it's not really "pie" more just like baked mac and cheese. It was a bit spicy but amazing, and stayed hot the whole time which was huge for me.   Our food took a REALLY long time. Like almost an hour long. But the owner/manager came over and told us he was buying the whole meal before we even complained, which I thought was excellent. I'm not one to complain and I probably wouldn't have done so, but that fact that he was proactive left me with an amazing impression and wanting to return. also, the food was well worth the wait.   It's pricey, but for a date night or special occasion I would be back in a heartbeat. I also saw they have bigger rooms in the back that would be great for groups which is cool.

Go1yBbK9Hmlzz_6Xybm5hA.text: Food was great and their white sangria was amazing. It was a bit pricey but well worth it.

768pv8Msua_zFkVxnR0siw.text: Just tried Pirata for the first time.  Our waiters were at our table immediately and the first mojitos were in our hands in a flash...and they were crafted to perfection (just like Cuba, according to one of our party).  We tried a number of the apps, all good...the adobo chicken wings were my favorite (ask to have the cilantro yogurt dipping sauce in addition to the blue cheese).  We also tried a couple of salads...the watermelon and honey one was particularly refreshing.   The entrees arrived as we were sampling a flight of rums. We tried all of the Caribbean tacos...the plantain crusted mahi mahi was amazing, and my friend raved about the curried goat with goat cheese. The jerk chicken was just right...not overly spicy and was a good complement to the heat of some of the tacos. So were the sweet plantains.   Speaking of sweet, we topped everything by sharing a serving of their decadent tres leches, which arrived just as the DJ started to play dance music, giving the place a fun late night beat. Bottom line: I look forward to coming back.
